definition: to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Ohhh, I think I broke my leg.
A cowboy fell off his horse and broke his leg on the prairie.
sentences.chinese: 一個牛仔在大草原上從馬背上摔了下來，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: Bill broke a leg or were hospitalized to a month.
sentences.chinese: 比爾摔斷了腿，被送進診所住了一個月。

sentences.english: The traffic accident racked up his left arm.
sentences.chinese: 這次車禍摔斷了他的左臂。

sentences.english: He spilt out of the tree, and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 他從樹上跌了下來，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: How did you break your arm?
He slipped on the street and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 他在馬路上滑了一跤，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: He broke his leg so he could no longer play football.
sentences.chinese: 他摔斷了腿，所以他不能再踢足球了。

sentences.english: Bill broke a leg and was hospitalized for a month.
sentences.chinese: 比爾摔斷了腿，被送進醫院住了一個月。

sentences.english: She slipped on the polished floor and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她滑倒在光滑的地板上，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: He fell heavily and broke his arm.
sentences.chinese: 他摔得很重，手臂都摔斷了。

sentences.english: The old lady slipped on the stairs and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 這位老太太在樓梯上失足摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: He slipped on the icy road and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 他在結冰的路面上滑倒而摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: Tom slipped on the ice and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆在冰上摔了一跤，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: I broke my leg skiing five years ago.
sentences.chinese: 五年前我滑雪的時候摔斷了腿。
